Tyrael thought. Cygnar's group wasn't that big, but he didn't know who 
was in it and what their strength were. But Cygnar's suggestion made 
sense, even though it left the Phoenix hungry.

Tyrael: So what you talk about is no more and no less than a common 
front against Hydras. My group is a small one though. Our firepower 
and battle ability is not feeble, but the Predacons are a ferocious 
lot. If we are to attack them, the Maximals will have to be the 
backbone of the force.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Rudra656@a... wrote:
> ::Cygnar::
>        "Actually I'm suggesting something quite different from both 
of 
> those."  He looks at both of his fellow commanders intently.  "You 
are after 
> all both my enemies.  You always will be, you must understand that. 
 I am 
> merely suggesting that we put our differences aside to eliminate a 
common 
> threat.  We will be allied until this battle is over.  Once Hydras 
is no 
> more, we may discuss further agreements."
